intro: Pilosella bauhini subsp. macra, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant is distinguished by its soft, hairy leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Pilosella bauhini subsp. macra is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators in its native environment.
